bibl.author: John M. Binckley
bibl.title: John M. Binckley to R. & J. Semmes, 13 April 1868
bibl.idno: Entry 10, Record Group 60, Letter Book G

revisionDesc.change: removed spaces surrounding em-dashes and inserted space between initials
checked file for values of @facs, further revised header information, revised encoding
changes to TEI header, including punctuation of titles and replacing initials with full names when possible

body.ab: Your letter of the 9th inst. has been referred to the Secretary of the Treasury, in whose files all the papers are kept relating to the real estate of the United States, occupied for Custom House purposes,—and among them, doubtless, the Act of the State Legislature ceding jurisdiction in the case you mention.—An affidavit should be presented at the Treasury Department from the party interested, setting forth the character of his interest, and praying a certified copy of the document.
